channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Trade Mixed
item.description: U.S. stocks were mixed as investors were considering a deal, signed into law by President Biden on Saturday, to avoid a government shutdown.

item.title: Why You May Want to Cheer for Money-Market Funds
item.description: Money funds remain an attractive place for excess cash, and can help keep a lid on short-term borrowing costs.

item.title: Two-year U.S. manufacturing slump shows little sign of ending
item.description: Durable-goods orders fall for third time in four months. Report comes out a day early following Christmas Eve executive order by Biden.

item.title: Nordstrom to go private after doing the math on facing bigger rivals
item.description: Retailer has been publicly traded since 1971 but said it sees better growth prospects ahead as a private business.

item.title: Is the stock market open on Christmas? Does the post office deliver mail?
item.description: It’s the height of the holiday season, so expect schedule changes.

item.title: They Thought They Were Nearly Done With Student Loans, but Then Came Trump
item.description: A signature piece of the Biden administration’s effort to reduce the $1.6 trillion student-loan burden is now in limbo, hitting public-service workers...

item.title: Consumer confidence dented by stock-market worries and threat of Trump tariffs
item.description: Consumer confidence index falls to 3-month low

item.title: Treasury Yields Rise Ahead of Consumer Sentiment Data
item.description: Treasury yields extended post-Fed gains following the passage of a stopgap spending bill to avert a U.S. government shutdown.

item.title: Xerox to Buy Printer Maker Lexmark From Chinese Owners
item.description: The deal values closely held Lexmark at $1.5 billion, including debt.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield edges up to kick off holiday-shortened week
item.description: Treasury yields edged higher on Monday, with the key 10-year rate hovering above 4.5%, after data showed U.S. consumer confidence pulled back in Decem...
